editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getCurrency().equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n            System.out.println("- Currency: " + currentPreferences.getCurrency() + " → " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit().equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n            System.out.println("- Temperature Unit: " + currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit() + \n                              " → " + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTheme().equals(editedPreferences.getTheme())) {\n            System.out.println("- Theme: " + currentPreferences.getTheme() + " → " + editedPreferences.getTheme());\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.getResultsPerPage() != editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage()) {\n            System.out.println("- Results per page: " + currentPreferences.getResultsPerPage() + \n                              " → " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() != editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n            System.out.println("- Accessibility Mode: " + \n                (currentPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + " → " + \n                (editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isEmailNotifications() != editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications()) {\n            System.out.println("- Email Notifications: " + \n                (currentPreferences.isEmailNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + " → " + \n                (editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isSmsNotifications() != editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications()) {\n            System.out.println("- SMS Notifications: " + \n                (currentPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + " → " + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isPushNotifications() != editedPreferences.isPushNotifications()) {\n            System.out.println("- Push Notifications: " + \n                (currentPreferences.isPushNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + " → " + \n                (editedPreferences.isPushNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        \n        Set<String> currentCats = currentPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        Set<String> editedCats = editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        if (!currentCats.equals(editedCats)) {\n            System.out.println("- Favorite Categories: " + currentCats + " → " + editedCats);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks for confirmation of the changes.\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     * @throws OperationCanceledException if user explicitly cancels the operation\n     */\n    public boolean confirmChanges() throws OperationCanceledException {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("Are you sure you want to save these changes?");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'yes\' to confirm, \'no\' to cancel, or \'review\' to see changes again.");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Your choice (yes/no/review): ");\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "yes":\n                    System.out.println("✓ Changes confirmed.");\n                    return true;\n                case "no":\n                    System.out.println("✗ Changes cancelled.");\n                    throw new OperationCanceledException("User cancelled the confirmation.");\n                case "review":\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Reviewing Changes ===");\n                    showDifference();\n                    System.out.println("\\nPlease confirm your decision:");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. Please enter \'yes\', \'no\', or \'review\'.");\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the updated preferences after editing.\n     * @return the edited Preference object\n     */\n    public Preference getUpdatedPreferences() {\n        return new Preference(editedPreferences);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the original (current) preferences.\n     * @return the original Preference object\n     */\n    public Preference getOriginalPreferences() {\n        return new Preference(currentPreferences);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if any changes were made to preferences.\n     * @return true if edited preferences differ from original, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasChanges() {\n        return !currentPreferences.equals(editedPreferences);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Closes the scanner resource.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. package com.etour.preference;

import java.io.*;
import java.util.Random;

/**
 * PreferenceService handles storage and retrieval of preferences,
 * and manages connection to the ETOUR server.
 * Provides methods to load and save preferences with simulation of server communication.
 * Handles edge cases like connection interruptions and file operations.
 */
public class PreferenceService {
    private static final String PREFERENCES_DIR = "preferences/";
    private static final Random random = new Random();
    
    /**
     * Loads preferences for the given tourist.
     * Simulates server connection and file operations.
     * @param tourist the tourist whose preferences to load
     * @return the loaded Preference object
     * @throws ConnectionInterruptedException if connection to ETOUR server fails
     */
    public static Preference loadPreferences(Tourist tourist) throws ConnectionInterruptedException {
        // Check server connection first
        if (!isServerAvailable()) {
            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Unable to connect to ETOUR server while loading preferences.");
        }
        
        String filename = PREFERENCES_DIR + tourist.getUserId() + ".pref";
        
        try {
            File file = new File(filename);
            if (!file.exists()) {
                System.out.println("No existing preferences found. Using default preferences.");
                return new Preference();
            }
            
            // In a real application, this would deserialize from server
            // For simulation, we'll create some realistic preferences
            Preference preferences = new Preference();
            preferences.setLanguage("English");
            preferences.setCurrency("USD");
            preferences.setTemperatureUnit("Celsius");
            preferences.setEmailNotifications(true);
            preferences.setSmsNotifications(false);
            preferences.setPushNotifications(true);
            preferences.setTheme("Light");
            preferences.setResultsPerPage(10);
            preferences.setAccessibilityMode(false);
            
            // Add some sample favorite categories
            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Adventure");
            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Cultural");
            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Beach");
            
            System.out.println("✓ Preferences loaded successfully from ETOUR server.");
            return preferences;
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Error loading preferences from ETOUR server: " + e.getMessage());
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Saves preferences for the given tourist.
     * Simulates server connection and storage operations.
     * @param tourist the tourist whose preferences to save
     * @param preferences the preferences to save
     * @throws ConnectionInterruptedException if connection to ETOUR server fails during save
     */
    public static void savePreferences(Tourist tourist, Preference preferences) throws ConnectionInterruptedException {
        // Check server connection first
        if (!isServerAvailable()) {
            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Unable to connect to ETOUR server while saving preferences.");
        }
        
        try {
            // Ensure preferences directory exists
            File dir = new File(PREFERENCES_DIR);
            if (!dir.exists()) {
                dir.mkdirs();
            }
            
            String filename = PREFERENCES_DIR + tourist.getUserId() + ".pref";
            
            // In a real application, this would serialize and send to server
            // For simulation, we'll just print a success message
            System.out.println("✓ Preferences saved successfully to ETOUR server.");
            System.out.println("File location: " + filename);
            
            // Simulate server processing time
            Thread.sleep(1000);
            
        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Save operation interrupted: " + e.getMessage());
        } catch (Exception e) {
            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Error saving preferences to ETOUR server: " + e.getMessage());
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Checks if the ETOUR server is available.
     * @return true if server is available, false otherwise
     */
    private static boolean isServerAvailable() {
        // Simulate server availability - 90% chance of success
        boolean available = random.nextDouble() > 0.1;
        
        if (!available) {
            System.out.println("⚠️ Warning: ETOUR server connection unstable.");
        }
        
        return available;
    }
    
    /**
     * Validates if the given tourist is authorized to modify preferences.
     * @param tourist the tourist to validate
     * @return true if authorized, false otherwise
     */
    public static boolean isAuthorized(Tourist tourist) {
        if (tourist == null) {
            return false;
        }
        return tourist.isAuthenticated();
    }
}

");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String> updatedCategories = new HashSet<>(editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n                boolean categoriesChanged = false;\n                \n                for (String op : operations) {\n category.substring(1).trim();\n                        if (!catToRemove.isEmpty() && updatedCategories.remove(catToRemove)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n      \n            // Add some sample favorite categories\n            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Adventure");\n            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Cultural");\n            preferences.addFavoriteCategory("Beach");\n            \n            System.out.println("✓ Preferences loaded successfully from ETOUR server.");\n            return preferences;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Error loading preferences from ETOUR server: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves preferences for the given tourist.\n     * Simulates server connection and storage operations.\n     * @param tourist the tourist whose preferences to save\n     * @param preferences the preferences to save\n     * @throws ConnectionInterruptedException if connection to ETOUR server fails during save\n     */\n    public static void savePreferences(Tourist tourist, Preference preferences) throws ConnectionInterruptedException {\n        // Check server connection first\n        if (!isServerAvailable()) {\n            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Unable to connect to ETOUR server while saving preferences.");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Ensure preferences directory exists\n            File dir = new File(PREFERENCES_DIR);\n            if (!dir.exists()) {\n                dir.mkdirs();\n            }\n            \n            String filename = PREFERENCES_DIR + tourist.getUserId() + ".pref";\n            \n            // In a real application, this would serialize and send to server\n            // For simulation, we\'ll just print a success message\n            System.out.println("✓ Preferences saved successfully to ETOUR server.");\n e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            throw new ConnectionInterruptedException("Save operation interrupted: " + e.getMessage());\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n 001|package com.etour.preference;
002|
003|import java.util.Scanner;
004|import java.util.InputMismatchException;
005|
006|/**
007| * Main application class for the ModifyGenericPreference use case.
008| * Simulates the flow for a tourist to edit their generic personal preferences.
009| */
010|public class ModifyGenericPreference {
011|    
012|    // Scanner for user input
013|    private static final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
014|    
015|    /**
016|     * Main method - entry point of the application.
017|     * @param args command line arguments (not used)
018|     */
019|    public static void main(String[] args) {
020|        System.out.println("=== ETOUR Personal Preference Modification System ===\n");
021|        
022|        try {
023|            // Step 0: Check authentication (simulated as entry condition)
024|            Tourist tourist = authenticateTourist();
025|            
026|            // Step 1: Access modification functionality
027|            System.out.println("\n=== Step 1: Accessing preference modification functionality ===");
028|            
029|            // Step 2: Load existing preferences into form
030|            System.out.println("=== Step 2: Loading current preferences ===");
031|            Preference currentPreferences = PreferenceService.loadPreferences(tourist);
032|            
033|            // Create form with current preferences
034|            PreferenceForm form = new PreferenceForm(currentPreferences);
035|            form.displayForm();
036|            
037|            // Step 3: Edit fields and submit
038|            System.out.println("\n=== Step 3: Editing preferences ===");
039|            boolean changesMade = form.editFields();
040|            
041|            if (!changesMade) {
042|                System.out.println("No changes were made. Operation cancelled.");
043|                return;
044|            }
045|            
046|            // Step 4: Ask for confirmation
047|            System.out.println("\n=== Step 4: Confirmation ===");
048|            boolean confirmed = form.confirmChanges();
049|            
050|            if (!confirmed) {
051|                System.out.println("Changes were not confirmed. Operation cancelled.");
052|                return;
053|            }
054|            
055|            // Step 5: Confirm the operation (already done in previous step)
056|            System.out.println("\n=== Step 5: Final confirmation received ===");
057|            
058|            // Step 6: Store changed preferences
059|            System.out.println("\n=== Step 6: Storing updated preferences ===");
060|            Preference updatedPreferences = form.getUpdatedPreferences();
061|            PreferenceService.savePreferences(tourist, updatedPreferences);
062|            
063|            // Success notification
064|            System.out.println("\n✅ SUCCESS: Generic personal preferences have been successfully modified!");
065|            System.out.println("Updated preferences:");
066|            System.out.println(updatedPreferences);
067|            
068|        } catch (OperationCanceledException e) {
069|            System.out.println("\n⚠️ Operation cancelled by user: " + e.getMessage());
070|        } catch (ConnectionInterruptedException e) {
071|            System.out.println("\n❌ Connection error: " + e.getMessage());
072|            System.out.println("Please check your internet connection and try again.");
073|        } catch (Exception e) {
074|            System.out.println("\n❌ An unexpected error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
075|            e.printStackTrace();
076|        } finally {
077|            scanner.close();
078|            System.out.println("\n=== Thank you for using ETOUR Preference System ===");
079|        }
080|    }
081|    
082|    /**
083|     * Simulates tourist authentication.
084|     * In a real system, this would connect to an authentication service.
085|     * @return authenticated Tourist object
086|     * @throws OperationCanceledException if authentication fails or is cancelled
087|     */
088|    private static Tourist authenticateTourist() throws OperationCanceledException {
089|        System.out.println("=== Tourist Authentication ===");
090|        
091|        // Simulate authentication process
092|        int attempts = 0;
093|        final int maxAttempts = 3;
094|        
095|        while (attempts < maxAttempts) {
096|            System.out.print("Enter username: ");
097|            String username = scanner.nextLine().trim();
098|            
099|            System.out.print("Enter password: ");
100|            String password = scanner.nextLine().trim();
101|            
102|            // Simple validation (in real system, this would verify against database)
103|            if (!username.isEmpty() && !password.isEmpty()) {
104|                System.out.println("✓ Authentication successful!");
105|                return new Tourist(username);
106|            } else {
107|                attempts++;
108|                System.out.println("✗ Authentication failed. Attempt " + attempts + " of " + maxAttempts);
109|                
110|                if (attempts < maxAttempts) {
111|                    System.out.print("Try again? (yes/no): ");
112|                    String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();
113|                    if (!response.equals("yes")) {
114|                        throw new OperationCanceledException("Authentication cancelled by user.");
115|                    }
116|                }
117|            }
118|        }
119|        
120|        throw new OperationCanceledException("Maximum authentication attempts exceeded.");
121|    }
122|    
123|    /**
124|     * Helper method to simulate server availability check.
125|     * @return true if server is available, false otherwise
126|     */
127|    private static boolean isServerAvailable() {
128|        // In a real application, this would ping the ETOUR server
129|        // For simulation, we'll randomly determine availability
130|        return Math.random() > 0.1; // 90% chance of being available
131|    }
132|}
133|
134|/**
135| * Custom exception for when the user cancels an operation.
136| */
137|class OperationCanceledException extends Exception {
138|    public OperationCanceledException(String message) {
139|        super(message);
140|    }
141|}
142|
143|/**
144| * Custom exception for when the connection to ETOUR server is interrupted.
145| */
146|class ConnectionInterruptedException extends Exception {
147|    public ConnectionInterruptedException(String message) {
148|        super(message);
149|    }
150|}

'content': 'Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyGenericPreferenceJava/PreferenceForm.java has been successfully created, with content:\npackage com.etour.preference;\n\nimport java.util.InputMismatchException;\nimport java.util.Scanner;\nimport java.util.Set;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\n\n/**\n * PreferenceForm class handles the form display, editing, and confirmation\n * for modifying personal preferences in the ETOUR system.\n */\npublic class PreferenceForm {\n    private Preference currentPreferences;\n    private Preference editedPreferences;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor that initializes the form with current preferences.\n     * @param currentPreferences the current preferences to display and edit\n     */\n    public PreferenceForm(Preference currentPreferences) {\n        this.currentPreferences = new Preference(currentPreferences);\n        this.editedPreferences = new Preference(currentPreferences);\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the current preferences in a form-like format.\n     */\n    public void displayForm() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== EDIT PERSONAL PREFERENCES ===");\n        System.out.println("Current settings:");\n        System.out.println(currentPreferences);\n        System.out.println("\\nYou can edit the following fields:");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Allows the user to edit form fields through console input.\n     * @return true if changes were made, false if user cancelled or made no changes\n     */\n    public boolean editFields() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Edit Fields ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter new values for each field (press Enter to keep current value):");\n        \n        boolean anyChanges = false;\n        \n        try {\n            // Edit language\n            System.out.print("\\n1. Language [" + editedPreferences.getLanguage() + "]: ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getLanguage())) {\n                editedPreferences.setLanguage(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Language updated to: " + editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit currency\n            System.out.print("2. Currency [" + editedPreferences.getCurrency() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n                editedPreferences.setCurrency(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Currency updated to: " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit temperature unit\n            System.out.print("3. Temperature Unit [" + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTemperatureUnit(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Temperature unit updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit theme\n            System.out.print("4. Theme [" + editedPreferences.getTheme() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTheme())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTheme(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Theme updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTheme());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit results per page\n            System.out.print("5. Results per page [" + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                try {\n                    int newResults = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                    if (newResults >= 5 && newResults <= 100 && newResults != editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage()) {\n                        editedPreferences.setResultsPerPage(newResults);\n                        anyChanges = true;\n                        System.out.println("   ✓ Results per page updated to: " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n                    }\n                } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                    System.out.println("   ✗ Invalid number format. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit accessibility mode\n            System.out.print("6. Accessibility Mode [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                if (input.equals("enable") && !editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(true);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode enabled");\n                } else if (input.equals("disable") && editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(false);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode disabled");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit notification settings\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Notification Settings ---");\n            \n            System.out.print("7. Email Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setEmailNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Email Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("8. SMS Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setSmsNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ SMS Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("9. Push Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isPushNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isPushNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setPushNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Push Notifications " + (newValue ? System.out.println("Current categories: " + editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n            System.out.print("Add categories (comma-separated) or remove with minus sign (e.g., -Adventure): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String> updatedCategories = new HashSet<>(editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n                boolean categoriesChanged = false;\n                \n                for (String op : operations) {\n                    String category = op.trim();\n                    if (category.startsWith("-")) {\n                        // Remove category\n                        String catToRemove = category.substring(1).trim();\n                        if (!catToRemove.isEmpty() && updatedCategories.remove(catToRemove)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Removed category: " + catToRemove);\n                        }\n                    } else if (!category.isEmpty()) {\n                        // Add category\n                        if (updatedCategories.add(category)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Added category: " + category);\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (categoriesChanged) {\n                    editedPreferences.setFavoriteCategories(updatedCategories);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Show summary of changes\n            if (anyChanges) {\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Changes Summary ===");\n                System.out.println("The following changes will be made:");\n                showDifference();\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("\\nNo changes were made to preferences.");\n            }\n            \n            return anyChanges;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during editing: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Shows the difference between current and edited preferences.\n     */\n    private void showDifference() {\n        if (currentPreferences.equals(editedPreferences)) {\n            System.out.println("No changes detected.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        if (!currentPreferences.getLanguage().equals(editedPreferences.getLanguage())) {\n            System.out.println("- Language: " + currentPreferences.getLanguage() + " → " + editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getCurrency().equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n            System.out.println("- Currency: " + currentPreferences.getCurrency() + " → " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit().equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n            System.out.println("- Temperature Unit: " + currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit() + \n                              " → " + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit());\n        }\n        if                            " → " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() != editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        \n        Set<String> currentCats = currentPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        Set<String> editedCats = editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        if (!currentCats.equals(editedCats)) {\n            System.out.println("- Favorite Categories: " + currentCats + " → " + editedCats);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks for confirmation of the changes.\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     * @throws OperationCanceledException if user explicitly cancels the operation\n     */\n    public boolean confirmChanges() throws OperationCanceledException {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("Are you sure you want to save these changes?");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'yes\' to confirm, \'no\' to cancel, or \'review\' to see changes again.");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Your choice (yes/no/review): ");\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "yes":\n                    System.out.println("✓ Changes confirmed.");\n                    return true;\n                case "no":\n                    System.out.println("✗ Changes cancelled.");\n                    throw new OperationCanceledException("User cancelled the confirmation.");\n                case "review":\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Reviewing Changes ===");\n                    showDifference();\n                    System.out.println("\\nPlease confirm your decision:");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. The new_content must be a complete block of code. Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002|new content 003|contain i ``` Example 2: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to remove the line 2 and line 3. edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"\\", ) This will remove line 2 and line 3. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. If there is overlap between the new code and the original code, use Editor.edit_file_by_replace instead.\n13. If you choose Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the original code that needs to be replaced must start at the beginning of the line and end at the end of the line\n14. When not specified, you should write files in a folder named "{project_name}_1766842055". The project name is the name of the project which meets the user\'s requirements.\n15. When provided system design or project schedule, you MUST read them first before making a plan, then adhere to them in your implementation, especially in the programming language, package, or framework. You MUST implement all code files prescribed in the system design or project schedule.\n16. When planning, initially list the files for coding, then outline all coding tasks based on the file organization in your first response.\n17. If you plan to read a file, do not include other plans in the same response.\n18. Write only one code file each time and provide its full implementation.\n19. When the requirement is simple, you don\'t need to create a plan, just do it right away.\n20. When using the editor, pay attention to current directory. When you use editor tools, the paths must be either absolute or relative to the editor\'s current directory.\n21. When planning, consider whether images are needed. If you are developing a showcase website, start by using ImageGetter.get_image to obtain the necessary images.\n22. When planning, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task. For example, create one task for writing unit tests for all functions in a class. Also in using the editor, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task.\n23. When create unit tests for a code file, use Editor.read() to read the code file before planing.    * @return true if the category was removed, false if it didn\'t exist\n     */\n    public boolean removeFavoriteCategory(String category) {\n        if (category != null) {\n            return "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("8. SMS Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String>                 String category = op.trim();\n                    if (category.startsWith("-")) {\n                        // Remove category\n                        String catToRemove =                     }\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (categoriesChanged) {\n                    editedPreferences.setFavoriteCategories(updatedCategories);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Show summary of changes\n Language [" + editedPreferences.getLanguage() + "]: ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getLanguage())) {\n                editedPreferences.setLanguage(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Language updated to: " + editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit currency\n            System.out.print("2. Currency [" + editedPreferences.getCurrency() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n                editedPreferences.setCurrency(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Currency updated to: " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit temperature unit\n            System.out.print("3. Temperature Unit [" + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTemperatureUnit(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Temperature unit updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit theme\n            System.out.print("4. Theme [" + editedPreferences.getTheme() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTheme())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTheme(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Theme updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTheme());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit results per page\n            System.out.print("5. Results per page [" + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                try {\n                    int newResults = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                    if (newResults >= 5 && newResults <= 100 && newResults != editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage()) {\n                        editedPreferences.setResultsPerPage(newResults);\n                        anyChanges = true;\n                        System.out.println("   ✓ Results per page updated to: " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n                    }\n                } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                    System.out.println("   ✗ Invalid number format. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit accessibility mode\n            System.out.print("6. Accessibility Mode [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                if (input.equals("enable") && !editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(true);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode enabled");\n                } else if (input.equals("disable") && editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(false);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode disabled");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit notification settings\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Notification Settings ---");\n            \n            System.out.print("7. Email Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setEmailNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Email Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("8. SMS Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setSmsNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ SMS Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("9. Push Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isPushNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isPushNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setPushNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Push Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit favorite categories\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Favorite Categories ---");\n            System.out.println("Current categories: " + editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n            System.out.print("Add categories (comma-separated) or remove with minus sign (e.g., -Adventure): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String> updatedCategories = new HashSet<>(editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n                boolean categoriesChanged = false;\n                \n                for (String op : operations) {\n                    String category = op.trim();\n                    if (category.startsWith("-")) {\n                        // Remove category\n                        String catToRemove = category.substring(1).trim();\n                        if (!catToRemove.isEmpty() && updatedCategories.remove(catToRemove)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Removed category: " + catToRemove);\n                        }\n                    } else if (!category.isEmpty()) {\n                        // Add category\n                        if (updatedCategories.add(category)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Added category: " + category);\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (categoriesChanged) {\n                    editedPreferences.setFavoriteCategories(updatedCategories);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Show summary of changes\n            if (anyChanges) {\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Changes Summary ===");\n                System.out.println("The following changes will be made:");\n                showDifference();\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("\\nNo changes were made to preferences.");\n            }\n            \n            return anyChanges;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during editing: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Shows the difference between current and edited preferences.\n     */\n    private void showDifference() {\n        if (currentPreferences.equals(editedPreferences)) {\n            System.out.println("No changes detected.");\n            return;\n currentPreferences.getCurrency() + " → " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit().equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        \n        Set<String> currentCats = currentPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        Set<String> editedCats = editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        if (!currentCats.equals(editedCats)) {\n            System.out.println("- Favorite Categories: " + currentCats + " → " + editedCats);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks for confirmation of the changes.\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     * @throws OperationCanceledException if user explicitly cancels the operation\n     */\n    public boolean confirmChanges() throws OperationCanceledException {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("Are you sure you want to save these changes?");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'yes\' to confirm, \'no\' to cancel, or \'review\' to see changes again.");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Your choice (yes/no/review): ");\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "yes":\n                    System.out.println("✓ Changes confirmed.");\n                    return true;\n                case "no":\n                    System.out.println("✗ Changes cancelled.");\n                    throw new OperationCanceledException("User cancelled the confirmation.");\n                case "review":\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Reviewing Changes ===");\n                    showDifference();\n                    System.out.println("\\nPlease confirm your decision:");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. 'content': 'Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyGenericPreferenceJava/PreferenceForm.java has been successfully created, with content:\npackage com.etour.preference;\n\nimport java.util.InputMismatchException;\nimport java.util.Scanner;\nimport java.util.Set;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\n\n/**\n * PreferenceForm class handles the form display, editing, and confirmation\n * for modifying personal preferences in the ETOUR system.\n */\npublic class PreferenceForm {\n    private Preference currentPreferences;\n    private Preference editedPreferences;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor that initializes the form with current preferences.\n     * @param currentPreferences the current preferences to display and edit\n     */\n    public PreferenceForm(Preference currentPreferences) {\n        this.currentPreferences = new Preference(currentPreferences);\n        this.editedPreferences = new Preference(currentPreferences);\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the current preferences in a form-like format.\n     */\n    public void displayForm() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== EDIT PERSONAL PREFERENCES ===");\n        System.out.println("Current settings:");\n        System.out.println(currentPreferences);\n        System.out.println("\\nYou can edit the following fields:");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Allows the user to edit form fields through console input.\n     * @return true if changes were made, false if user cancelled or made no changes\n     */\n    public boolean editFields() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Edit Fields ---");\n        System.out.println("Enter new values for each field (press Enter to keep current value):");\n        \n        boolean anyChanges = false;\n        \n        try {\n            // Edit language\n            System.out.print("\\n1. Language [" + editedPreferences.getLanguage() + "]: ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getLanguage())) {\n                editedPreferences.setLanguage(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Language updated to: " + editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit currency\n            System.out.print("2. Currency [" + editedPreferences.getCurrency() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n                editedPreferences.setCurrency(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Currency updated to: " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit temperature unit\n            System.out.print("3. Temperature Unit [" + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTemperatureUnit(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Temperature unit updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit theme\n            System.out.print("4. Theme [" + editedPreferences.getTheme() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTheme())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTheme(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Theme updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTheme());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit results per page\n            System.out.print("5. Results per page [" + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                try {\n                    int newResults = Integer.parseInt(input);\n                    if (newResults >= 5 && newResults <= 100 && newResults != editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage()) {\n                        editedPreferences.setResultsPerPage(newResults);\n                        anyChanges = true;\n                        System.out.println("   ✓ Results per page updated to: " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n                    }\n                } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n                    System.out.println("   ✗ Invalid number format. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit accessibility mode\n            System.out.print("6. Accessibility Mode [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                if (input.equals("enable") && !editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(true);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode enabled");\n                } else if (input.equals("disable") && editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setAccessibilityMode(false);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Accessibility Mode disabled");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit notification settings\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Notification Settings ---");\n            \n            System.out.print("7. Email Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isEmailNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setEmailNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Email Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("8. SMS Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setSmsNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ SMS Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("9. Push Notifications [" + \n                (editedPreferences.isPushNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + "] (enable/disable): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                boolean newValue = input.equals("enable");\n                if (newValue != editedPreferences.isPushNotifications()) {\n                    editedPreferences.setPushNotifications(newValue);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                    System.out.println("   ✓ Push Notifications " + (newValue ? "enabled" : "disabled"));\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit favorite categories\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Favorite Categories ---");\n            System.out.println("Current categories: " + editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n            System.out.print("Add categories (comma-separated) or remove with minus sign (e.g., -Adventure): ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String> updatedCategories = new HashSet<>(editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n                boolean categoriesChanged = false;\n                \n                for (String op : operations) {\n                    String category = op.trim();\n                    if (category.startsWith("-")) {\n                        // Remove category\n                        String catToRemove = category.substring(1).trim();\n                        if (!catToRemove.isEmpty() && updatedCategories.remove(catToRemove)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Removed category: " + catToRemove);\n                        }\n                    } else if (!category.isEmpty()) {\n                        // Add category\n                        if (updatedCategories.add(category)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Added category: " + category);\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (categoriesChanged) {\n                    editedPreferences.setFavoriteCategories(updatedCategories);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Show summary of changes\n            if (anyChanges) {\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Changes Summary ===");\n                System.out.println("The following changes will be made:");\n                showDifference();\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("\\nNo changes were made to preferences.");\n            }\n            \n            return anyChanges;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during editing: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Shows the difference between current and edited preferences.\n     */\n    private void showDifference() {\n        if (currentPreferences.equals(editedPreferences)) {\n            System.out.println("No changes detected.");\n            return;\n currentPreferences.getCurrency() + " → " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit().equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n                            " → " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() != editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isSmsNotifications() != editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications()) {\n            System.out.println("- SMS Notifications: " + \n                (currentPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled") + " → " + \n                (editedPreferences.isSmsNotifications() ? "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        \n        Set<String> currentCats = currentPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        Set<String> editedCats = editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        if (!currentCats.equals(editedCats)) {\n            System.out.println("- Favorite Categories: " + currentCats + " → " + editedCats);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks for confirmation of the changes.\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     * @throws OperationCanceledException if user explicitly cancels the operation\n     */\n    public boolean confirmChanges() throws OperationCanceledException {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("Are you sure you want to save these changes?");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'yes\' to confirm, \'no\' to cancel, or \'review\' to see changes again.");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Your choice (yes/no/review): ");\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "yes":\n                    System.out.println("✓ Changes confirmed.");\n                    return true;\n                case "no":\n                    System.out.println("✗ Changes cancelled.");\n                    throw new OperationCanceledException("User cancelled the confirmation.");\n                case "review":\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Reviewing Changes ===");\n                    showDifference();\n                    System.out.println("\\nPlease confirm your decision:");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice. process\n        int attempts = 0;\n        final int maxAttempts = 3;\n        \n        while (attempts < maxAttempts) {\n            System.out.print("Enter username: ");\n            String validation (in real system, this would verify against database)\n            if (!username.isEmpty() && !password.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Authentication successful!");\n                return new Tourist(username);\n            } else {\n                attempts++;\n                System.out.println("✗ Authentication failed. Attempt " + attempts + " of " + maxAttempts);\n                \n                if (attempts < maxAttempts) {\n                    System.out.print("Try again? generateUserId(String username) {\n        // Simple hash-based generation for simulation\n        int hash = Math.abs(username.hashCode());\n        return "USER_" + hash;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n the form display, editing, and confirmation\n * for modifying personal preferences in the ETOUR system.\n */\npublic class PreferenceForm {\n    private Preference currentPreferences;\n    private Preference editedPreferences;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor that initializes the form with current preferences.\n     * @param currentPreferences the current */\n    public void displayForm() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== EDIT PERSONAL PREFERENCES ===");\n        System.out.println("Current settings:");\n       System.out.print("\\n1. Language [" + editedPreferences.getLanguage() + "]: ");\n            String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getLanguage())) {\n                editedPreferences.setLanguage(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Language updated to: " + editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit currency\n            System.out.print("2. Theme [" + editedPreferences.getTheme() + "]: ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            if (!input.isEmpty() && !input.equals(editedPreferences.getTheme())) {\n                editedPreferences.setTheme(input);\n                anyChanges = true;\n                System.out.println("   ✓ Theme updated to: " + editedPreferences.getTheme());\n            }\n            \n            // Edit results per page\n            System.out.print("5. Keeping current value.");\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Edit accessibility mode\n            System.out.print("6. ");\n            input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            if (!input.isEmpty()) {\n                String[] operations = input.split(",");\n                Set<String> updatedCategories = new HashSet<>(editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories());\n                boolean categoriesChanged = false;\n                \n                for (String op : operations) {\n                    String category = op.trim();\n                    if (category.startsWith("-")) {\n                        // Remove category\n                        String catToRemove = category.substring(1).trim();\n                        if (!catToRemove.isEmpty() && updatedCategories.remove(catToRemove)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Removed category: " + catToRemove);\n                        }\n                    } else if (!category.isEmpty()) {\n                        // Add category\n                        if (updatedCategories.add(category)) {\n                            categoriesChanged = true;\n                            System.out.println("   ✓ Added category: " + category);\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (categoriesChanged) {\n                    editedPreferences.setFavoriteCategories(updatedCategories);\n                    anyChanges = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            // Show summary of changes\n         } else {\n                System.out.println("\\nNo changes were made to preferences.");\n            }\n            \n            return anyChanges;\n            \n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during editing: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Shows the difference between current and edited preferences.\n     */\n    private void showDifference() {\n        if (currentPreferences.equals(editedPreferences)) {\n            System.out.println("No changes detected.");\n            return;\n editedPreferences.getLanguage());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getCurrency().equals(editedPreferences.getCurrency())) {\n            System.out.println("- Currency: " + currentPreferences.getCurrency() + " → " + editedPreferences.getCurrency());\n        }\n        if (!currentPreferences.getTemperatureUnit().equals(editedPreferences.getTemperatureUnit())) {\n                            " → " + editedPreferences.getResultsPerPage());\n        }\n        if (currentPreferences.isAccessibilityMode() != editedPreferences.isAccessibilityMode()) {\n "Enabled" : "Disabled"));\n        }\n        \n        Set<String> currentCats = currentPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        Set<String> editedCats = editedPreferences.getFavoriteCategories();\n        if (!currentCats.equals(editedCats)) {\n            System.out.println("- Favorite Categories: " + currentCats + " → " + editedCats);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks for confirmation of the changes.\n     * @return true if user confirms, false if user cancels\n     * @throws OperationCanceledException if user explicitly cancels the operation\n     */\n    public boolean confirmChanges() throws OperationCanceledException {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== CONFIRMATION REQUIRED ===");\n        System.out.println("Are you sure you want to save these changes?");\n        System.out.println("Enter \'yes\' to confirm, \'no\' to cancel, or \'review\' to see changes again.");\n        \n        while (true) {\n            System.out.print("Your choice (yes/no/review): ");\n            String choice = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            switch (choice) {\n                case "yes":\n                    System.out.println("✓ Changes confirmed.");\n                    return true;\n                case "no":\n                    System.out.println("✗ Changes cancelled.");\n                    throw new OperationCanceledException("User cancelled the confirmation.");\n                case "review":\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Reviewing Changes ===");\n                    showDifference();\n                    System.out.println("\\nPlease confirm your decision:");\n                    break;\n                default:\n                    System.out.println("Invalid choice.
